Package com.jme.bullet.joints

Class SixDofJoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jme.bullet.joints.PhysicsJoint
      • com.jme.bullet.joints.SixDofJoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.jme.export.Savable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SixDofSpringJoint
    public class SixDofJoint
extends PhysicsJoint
    A joint based on Bullet's btGeneric6DofConstraint.

    From the Bullet manual:
    This generic constraint can emulate a variety of standard constraints, by configuring each of the 6 degrees of freedom (dof). The first 3 dof axis are linear axis, which represent translation of rigidbodies, and the latter 3 dof axis represent the angular motion. Each axis can be either locked, free or limited. On construction of a new btGeneric6DofSpring2Constraint, all axis are locked. Afterwards the axis can be reconfigured. Note that several combinations that include free and/or limited angular degrees of freedom are undefined.

    For each axis:

    • Lowerlimit = Upperlimit → axis is locked
    • Lowerlimit > Upperlimit → axis is free
    • Lowerlimit < Upperlimit → axis it limited in that range
    Author:
    normenhansen

    • Constructor Detail

      • SixDofJoint

        public SixDofJoint()
        No-argument constructor needed by SavableClassUtil. Do not invoke directly!

      • SixDofJoint

        public SixDofJoint​(PhysicsRigidBody nodeA,
                   PhysicsRigidBody nodeB,
                   com.jme.math.Vector3f pivotA,
                   com.jme.math.Vector3f pivotB,
                   com.jme.math.Matrix3f rotA,
                   com.jme.math.Matrix3f rotB,
                   boolean useLinearReferenceFrameA)
        Instantiate a SixDofJoint. To be effective, the joint must be added to a physics space.
        Parameters:
        nodeA - the 1st body connected by the joint (not null, alias created)
        nodeB - the 2nd body connected by the joint (not null, alias created)
        pivotA - the local offset of the connection point in node A (not null, alias created)
        pivotB - the local offset of the connection point in node B (not null, alias created)
        rotA - the local orientation of the connection to node A (not null, alias created)
        rotB - the local orientation of the connection to node B (not null, alias created)
        useLinearReferenceFrameA - true→use node A, false→use node B
